industry: Technology, Information and Internet, IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development
description: As a HRBP, you will focus on supporting our workforce by aligning HR initiatives to business goals. In this role, you will be a consultant to managers on people and organizational matters. You will work with employees to provide ‘hands-on’ support on all HR-related matters. You will be responsible for assessing and anticipating business unit-level HR needs, developing appropriate and compliant solutions to support the workforce, and partner with other team members and relevant stakeholders across the company to implement effective solutions in an efficient manner.
responsibilities: Consult with line managers and provide day-to-day guidance on HR matters, Educate and guide employees on HR policies, processes and procedures, Resolve complex employee relations issues and address grievances effectively, Analyze trends and metrics relevant to HR, Collaborate with managers and employees to improve work relationships, build morale and increase productivity and retention, Evaluate the use of HR products and services to identify areas for improvement, Identify opportunities to improve HR processes, Support the development and implementation of improvements to HR processes, Gather and analyze root causes of issues and potential risks, and develop effective and realistic plans to mitigate them, Support the implementation of innovative HR solutions to manage organizational change, engage employees, increase org effectiveness and strategic talent management, Resolve employee relations issues efficiently and effectively, including conducting investigations when necessary, Support the effective and accurate administration of payroll and benefits processes, Ensure the accuracy and integrity of HR data in systems and adhere to set HR governance practices, Gather and utilize relevant data to drive key HR metrics related to talent attraction, engagement and retention, Manage HR projects and champion HR initiatives, Partner with managers to help align people management practices that support and drive high performance, Coach managers to proactively manage employee and team performance, and other employee relations issues, Build strong professional relationship with managers and employees, Gather data to form a good understanding of the employee engagement and cultural pulse of the organization, Develop and support initiatives to maintain a high level of employee engagement, Act as a supportive and enthusiastic team player and encourage a positive work environment, Represent HR as a professional and trusted partner across all levels, Performs other tasks as needed.

qualifications.required: 5+ years of experience in an HRBP role, Knowledge of all HR functions and best practices, Ability to provide guidance and support to business unit managers, Experience in development and implementation of people strategies, Knowledge of HR policies and procedures, Understanding of business unit objectives, operations and challenges, Ability to translate business objectives into HR initiatives, Ability to integrate HR initiatives with business unit operations, Experience coaching and guiding members of the business unit(s) they serve, Experience coaching business managers on people management and talent strategies, Strong influencing skills, Effective communication skills (verbal and written), Excellent interpersonal and listening skills, Ability to build and maintain strong customer relationships, Strong analytical skills, Demonstrated experience with HR metrics, Ability to gather and interpret raw data, document and analyze findings and develop appropriate recommendations, Strong knowledge of employment legislation, Ability to collaborate effectively with other members of HR, Experience in conflict resolution, Experience working with virtual teams, Strong customer service orientation, Strong ability to build trust and maintain confidentiality of information, Experience in project management, Strong attention to detail

benefits: Physical Health benefits: Medical, Dental & Vision: Employee - employer paid premium 100%, Company contribution to a HSA when electing the High Deductible Health Plan, For plans that offer coverage to your dependents, you pay a small contribution, Mental Health benefits: Free access to CALM app for employees and dependents, Employee Training, Mental Health seminars and Q&A sessions, Basic Life & AD&D - employer paid 1x salary up to $250,000, 401(k) Retirement Plan (with employer match contribution), Generous PTO, Paid Sick Leave, and Company Holidays, Supplemental, voluntary benefits: Student Loan Repayment/529 Education Savings - including a company contribution, FSA (Medical, Dependent, Transit and Parking), Voluntary Life and AD&D Insurance, Critical Illness Insurance, Accident Insurance, Short- and Long-term Disability Insurance, Pet Insurance, Family planning/fertility, Identity theft protection, Legal access to a network of attorneys, Paid parental leave.
remoteWork: Hybrid - 2 to 3 days onsite per week in Irvine, CA
